div.p:
Jasmine is a small Javascript testing DOM-less framework. It is a successor of JSUnit and it can be downloaded and published on a server to execute test runners. Also, it can be executed through its ruby gem, which makes it a lot easier to use for continuous integration.
It was created by authors of jsUnit and Screw.Unit. Using a different approach than JSpec, Jasmine uses Java Script syntax to the maximum instead of trying to mimic Ruby.
You do not need to configure the plugin before using it. However, you must install the Ruby environment as well as the Jasmine gem and its dependencies (rake, rack, win32console, rspec, selenium-rc).

When creating a procedure, do the following:
Click the Add Step on the Steps panel.
Select jasmine from the Test Tools category.
Complete the appropriate fields. The following fields are available:
Rakefile location - Absolute path to the rakefile that has the Jasmine tasks to be executed.
Type of execution - Selects the target that will be executed for the Rake invocation, either jasmine or jasmine:ci for the default mode and Selenium respectively.
Additional Rake Commands - Additional commands to be executed for Rake.
Working directory - Desired working directory. Leave blank to use the default workspace.
